description:
An OAD that will be distributed to customers who buy all 13 DVD or Blu-ray Disc volumes of the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond Is Unbreakable anime.

Adapts Fugou Mura, Zangeshitsu, The Run, and Mutsukabezaka.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Fitness
tags.description: Centers around exercise with the aim of improving physical health.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

name.native: フィットネストレーナー

node.description:
Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasufumiSoejima/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/soejima_yasufumi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ys19710313)

A director with past experience in computer graphics. Former CG animator and director at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO). He is currently affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1059938929485344774)

Freelance animator and designer. Formerly affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287) and known for his extensive work on the *Jojo's Bizarre Adventure* anime series.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fringon/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fringon) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/pedro.alcantara.1610) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@fringontv) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@_fringon) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/fringon)

Pedro Alcântara Machado de Vasconcelos (Jacareí, November 22, 1994) is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actor [Ricardo Vasconcelos](https://anilist.co/staff/202508/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Pablo (1st voice - 1st-3rd season; The Backyardigans)
- Beck Oliver (Victorious)
- Tyler Navarro / Dino Charge Red Ranger (Power Rangers: Dino Charge)
- Coby (One Piece Live Action)
- Kim Dong-Ha (Happy Ending)
- Reminald R. "Remy" Remington (Big City Greens)
- Bradley Nicholson (Milo Murphy's Law)
- Charles Ronson (Horizon Zero Dawn)
- Hae-Rang (Sweet Home)
- Howard "Howie" (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Silas Plaskett (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Charles "Charlie" St. George (13 Reasons Why)
- Ron Stoppable (Kim Possible Live Action)
!~

Twitter **Irwin Daayán Rosenthal Sarlí** is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Yugi Muto and Pharaoh Atem in _Yu-Gi-Oh!_, Anakin Skywalker in _Star Wars_ and Samsagaz "Sam" Gamyi in _The Lord of the Rings_. He is the recurring dub voice of Sebastian Stan and Hayden Christensen. Non-Anime Roles: - Ajay Ghale (Far Cry 4) - Kung Jin (Mortal Kombat X) - Kindred (League of Legends)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

Takashi Tanazawa is an animator.

_Note: Not to be confused with the director and former Top Craft employee [Takashi Tanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/215231/)._
_Note: not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/169408/)._
